title: Why can't we have both clients like we currently do permanently?
body:
I'm not a huge fan for the new client as I don't like the UI.

At the moment we are able to go back and fourth between the 2 clients with no problem. So why can't Riot just keep it like that for the people who prefer the old client? I understand the new client has a few more features but none of which are important to me.

replies.body:
Hey,

I totally understand your frustration as I'm also someone that doesn't like changes :)
Unfortunately it is not possible to keep both. If we kept both, we would have to allocate 2 teams to support both which ultimately would occupy resources better used somewhere else. Also Air has so many issues and limitations that would mean some features would not be possible to be deployed and would make players and developers life a nightmare.

Hope you can understand and hope you (and) we will get used to this one.

MM

I am keeping an open mind as it is only open beta.  But please for the life of me fix the slowness of it, that's one of the main reasons why I dislike it.

Sort of sucks though. I'm gonna miss the legacy client :/

As an added note due to things i have heard from other Riot sources that Mirk left out.

The new client having to interface with the old one actually causes a slugishness in some of the commands (for example it can take a few seconds to pick a champion) as it is still interfacing primarily with the old client, and the old client is outdated by a long shot.
This is basically like when Summoner's Rift got updated. "Can we please keep the old map?".

- relist Item set,
- show list of names recently played
- time indication in champ select more prominent
- fix single player vs bots bugs

As Mirkinen pointed out, it's just far too much of a hassle to keep both clients. Think of it like having two "duo lanes" in a "standard" game. This basically means you'd be sacrificing significant power from another position (probably Jungle) *just* to keep your "secondary" duo lane "at pace" with their lane opponent and the enemy position that your team lacks. It's extremely problematic and is effectively a waste of perfectly good resources, which is why you rarely (if *ever*) see it actually happen, even in "screw around" games.
Another day on the boards, another day of stupid ideas {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}
